comments.commentBody: Think donald decided to run at the correspondence dinner where he was humiliated by Barack Obama.He bullied his way to front of the overcrowded field of republican hopefuls on name recognition and media ratings.Everyone was amazed at his staunch supporters,no one more than mr trump himself.He had tapped into seven years of Democratic rule and Republican obstruction.Oh but now I have a chance to win the Presidency.How?he thought.We found out when he could not remember who David Duke was,when John McCain became a coward,Mexicans rapist and drug dealers,Muslims our enemies,that women are objects and America is a third World country.Quite a diversion because Mr trump had figured out why he had a following,he had no idea how to lead it.Now we are at a point of no return!While Mr trump could win republican nomination it is obviously impossible for him to become President.(thank god).The American people can defend our Country from this vicious attack on the values our forefathers died for.No I don't think Mr trump's motives of political power,monetary greed and plain old revenge are evil.I just believe he is a charlatan trying to flimflam his way to the White House.Surely someone will expose Mr trump before he does anyone and everyone any more damage.

If Trump was not a billionaire (or even a millionaire), he'd be absolutely nothing.
He's a boorish, loud, ignorant and rude man. I wonder if he'd been able to hold on to any woman if not for his wealth, unless the woman enjoyed being with a misogynist. He not only acts like a buffoon, he looks like one. He's like a fabulously wealthy, but less likable, Ralph Kramden/Archie Bunker.

"Of course, not all of the new Republicans left the Democrats because of racial resentment."

Well, some, like myself, left to support Ron Paul in 2012.

There hasn't until now been much incentive to stay Republican but there has been even less incentive to go back.

Here's hoping for a Bernie-Donald line-up for November. Not only because it would be the first time in decades where both candidates were not vetted by the corporate elite but because of the unique opportunity it would present to hear debates in "New York-ese".

The Ferguson riots, particularly the victim's father's call to burn the place down and other city outbursts, regardless of whether their trigger was justified or  not, has created much of the racial animosity felt by traditional blue-collar white males that are causing them to vote for Trump.  And Clinton's pandering to the Blacks while campaigning in the south only increased votes for Trump.

Simple answers, one legit....these voters are really concerned about the economic genocide policy of USA farming out all the better paying blue collar jobs that republicans followed since 1980 (with democratic support). to de facto slave labor countries like China, Vietnam, Mexico etc, We cannot compete with slave labor under the guise of free trade. We must have true fair trade.

The other not legit, ie following a demagogue like Trump to change it. He is a bigoted, ego maniac, race baiting, demagogue that is only interested in himself and will more likely screw it up than make it better.

Bernie, is the more upscale clone of Trump on the left, ie preaching a good spiel but more likely to turn America back to the welfare state of the 1960s that almost destroyed America's cities with his de facto pure socialistic talk.

We need a candidate that sees where we went wrong re college tuition, farming out jobs, no win wars etc and come up with common sense solutions to them instead of demagog type or ideological pure thought.
Even if the guy can't think properly, he is fresh air to those who are sick tired of political correctness.

If Trump wins will that not put the republicans in a very bad position. If they try to do to him what they did to Obama he will fight back and it will be ugly. Trump is a street fighter, if you throw a rock at him, he throws back a grenade. If he wins how long will it be before he has the republican congress at their knees begging Donald to stop attacking them.

Cokie Roberts has a very telling insight about 10 days ago on MSNBC Morning Joe:  the statistics, evidence, etc.has been there for 20 years now that many blue collar jobs are going away.  Trump supporters cling to them like a child clings to its blankie or pacifier.  At a certain point, it is difficult to have sympathy with these folks, just as it is with anyone who chooses to live in a never ending state of denial.

Trump supporters and voters aren't who the Times think they are. Pollsters need to consider the "I won't admit it but I do like Trump" voter. These are the blue state Republicans and blue state Democrats--and if Trump can seem moderately disciplined down the stretch they will swing big for him. Many older male Democrats simply don't want to vote for Mrs. Clinton.
Why does not the writer consider the Jewish religion's vote, or Islam's religion's vote, as  he does the Catholic religion's vote?

Blue state republicans feel like they're the minority, that they're being discriminated against with respect to advancement, government support, employment, ... - at least that's what they've been told by the GOP.  The black president has place a target on their backs, forcing them to fall further and further behind or taxed more and more heavily.  Baloney! The GOP has convinced them that they deserve more, oh for those halcyon days of yore ...

Democrats and the media still don't see the problem they created. When you spend seven years trying to shame the thoughts and actions of 50% of Americans what do they expect?  Sounding the alarm against Trump, what about the alarm against Hillary or Bernie? A self proclaimed socialist who wants to destroy the current US economy while taxing working Americans into the poor house and Hilary who's foreign policies were responsible for the destabilization of both Syria and Libya.
Massachusetts is not famously liberal. That's a myth.

Last weekend I saw Dan Rather on a talkshow, and he mentioned that never before in our history have we had a race like this one where BOTH the leading contenders in each party had such high unfavorable ratings

The election may swing on: a) who is the least objectionable,
and b) fear over who will get to decide the balance of the Supreme Court

On a further not about public ratings of the candidates: Trump & Clinton also have the highest ratings as being more dishonest than honest, with Ms Clinton being viewed as aprox 5-10% more dishonest than Trump, with most of the GOP being likewise dishonest, but dropping off at about 10-15% below Mr. Trump
Also in those 'honesty' ratings, there are 3 folks viewed significantly more honest than dishonest: Sanders has the highest net-honesty rating, followed by Ben Carson, and then Kasich

I wish the article told me what a "racist web search" is exactly. I would think that a lot of the searching about "KKK" or "KuKluxKlan" or "David Duke" in the last month is people who don't know much or anything about those items because they're not usually in the news any more.

If Mr. Trump hadn't entered the race, would Jeb Bush being winning those blue states against Ted Cruz? What an awful choice.

When are one of you experts going to compare the demographics of Trump voters to the talk radio they listen to. Ever heard of Michael Savage? A whole bunch of Trump supporters have, but not many New York Times readers. Is time for the Times, and for that matter, the rest of the mainstream media, to do so very painful research....which is to say, listen to the odious Michael Wiener AKA Savage; find out where he is popular, and compare that to where Trump polls well. That and "Breitbart." These awful folks are the gas in Trump's engine. It's high time the media looked under the hood and told that story
As a Californian, I believe that some of the blue states contain some slightly more liberal Republican voters, at least a significant number who would see Trump as an evil lesser than Cruz.

It’s disgusting that modern Republicans still label themselves as the “party of Lincoln”. The only thing today’s Republican Party has in common with the party of Abraham Lincoln is the name. If Abraham Lincoln were alive today, he would not be made welcome in the Republican Party and would not feel comfortable being a part of it.
Trump fanatics love bad-mood cats.  Take a good look: TRUMP = GRUMPY CAT of politics.

"So far, there has been a strong relationship between Mr. Trump’s share of the vote by state and measures of racial animosity or bias." Huh, so the Times's view is that Massachusetts, where Trump got his biggest victory, is a hotbed of racial animosity and bias?  Who knew?

Where do they get the strange idea that there isn't a fairly large contingent of less well off and less well educated Republican voters in states like CT and MA. The Republicans in CT are not all investment bankers and retired business executives.

The pundits are in for a big surprise on election day eve if Trump is the nominee.  Have they ever considered that millions are voting for Trump, who is as we all know, unelectable, in the primaries so they can vote democratic and see him crushed in the general.  That's what I did in Florida.

Last July I put $100 on Trump to win in November. The Vegas odds were 40-1. I did this after reading the statistic that congress approval rating is under 20%.

When over 80% of Americans think the very people they elected are doing a horrible job you have a big big problem. Americans hate their politicians, and Trump is the ultimate Anti-Policitican.

In the Presidential elections of 2008 and 2012, 57% and 59% of American white people voted McCain/Palin and then Romney/Ryan. Yet the Kenyan Luo Arab Muslim socialist usurper won popular and electoral vote majorities and has been occupying the White House ever since.

The fact that they are mostly aged and living in the South and Mountain West made them less impactful than they otherwise might have been. Instead of one national election we have 50 state elections at one time. And blacks voted 90+% plus for the Democrat as they have in every election since 1964.

In the allegedly " post- racial" Age of Mr. Obama, a majority of his fellow white Americans preferred an all white by biology man as President instead of a half-white by natural biology man like the President. There are no blue nor red states. But there are plenty of white states.

replies.commentBody: Perhaps that's the reality and fortunately for us there are more female voters. Misogeny in the U.S. is just as powerful an influence as racism. Sad but true.

comments.userLocation: up in the woods down by the river
comments.commentBody:
The pundits keep talking about Trump and the collapse of the Republican Party. If Hillary wins the Democratic Party's nomination based only on the margin provided by super-delegates, we are going to see a collapse of everything we thought was familiar in American presidential politics.

Clinton vs Trump (if that is where we end up) is going to split closer along the lines of women vs men than Democrat vs Republican.
